body.name: Denon PerL Pro True Wireless Earbuds with Active Noise Cancellation, Spatial Audio, and Adaptive Acoustic Technology
body.stockDetail: Only 16 left in stock - order soon.
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 13 hrs 42 mins
features: PERSONALIZED SOUND - The Denon PerL Pro True Wireless Earbuds are powered by Masimo Adaptive Acoustic Technology and combines lossless and spatial audio technologies to deliver an unrivaled listening experience. Fully customize with Denon Headphones app

LOSSLESS & SPATIAL AUDIO - Savor premium Bluetooth audio with CD-quality uncompressed sound clarity from Qualcomm aptX Lossless technology and feel like you are in the middle of your audio content with spatial audio from Dirac Virtuo

BEST-IN-CLASS VOICE CALLS - Your calls will be clearer than ever with Qualcomm aptX Voice for super wideband (32kHz) voice calls and eight microphones for voice pickup. With the Multipoint feature, you can seamlessly connect two devices at the same time

DENON SIGNATURE SOUND - Hand-tuned by the Denon Sound Master to deliver the vivid and spacious Denon signature sound audio experience. With 5 tip options & 2 wings, these wireless earbuds stay in place comfortably, so you can keep the music going all day

NOISE CANCELING EARBUDS - With adaptive active noise cancelation, these earbuds automatically adjust and tune out world distractions. Choose Social Mode to hear your surroundings or Immersion Mode to adjust the bass level for your music genre & preference

CUSTOMIZABLE TOUCH CONTROLS - Each wireless earbud has 4 fully customizable touch inputs to let you control play/pause, skip track, change volume, and more. They are also great workout earbuds with an IPX4 sweat and water-resistant rating

LONG-LASTING BATTERY LIFE - When out of the case, the Bluetooth earbuds offer 8 hours of playback on Normal Mode (mixed usage of ANC, spatial mode, multi-point & 50% volume), and 24 hours of power on Low Power Mode (all features off) in the charging case

OVER A CENTURY OF AUDIO INNOVATION - Our dedication to groundbreaking sound innovation has cemented Denon's reputation as a visionary and a tastemaker, not only with our customers, but with our partners and competitors
body.description: Denon PerL Pro True Wireless Earbuds with Adaptive ANC Personalize your sound with Denon PerL Pro True Wireless Earbuds, powered by Masimo Adaptive Acoustic Technology (ATT) and Denon's self-learning engine that analyzes otoacoustic emissions, creating an individualized hearing profile with fine-tuned music experience that reveals every musical nuance with crystal clarity. With 8 microphones, Qualcomm AptX Lossless, Dirac Virtuo, and Denon Sound Master tuning, enjoy Denon's signature audio quality. Use Denon Headphones app to create your own unique hearing profile. Adaptive ANC intelligently adapts to your environment, fine-tuning noise levels. With different modes, choose the way you want to listen to your music. Stay aware with Social Mode and fine-tune your bass levels with Immersion Mode to immerse yourself in music your way. The Denon Headphones app also lets you fine-tune controls, switch effortlessly between noise-canceling and social modes, and shape your soundstage to reflect your style.The IPX4-rated Denon PerL Pro True Wireless Earbuds offer up to 8 hours of playback on Normal Mode (mixed usage of ANC, spatial mode, multi-point, and 50% volume), and 24 hours of power on Low Power Mode (all features turned off), when in the charging case. The case supports charging via Qi-pad and USB-C cable.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Masimo Adaptive Acoustic Technology (AAT) Normal hearing varies from person to person and can impact your listening experience. Masimo MT automatically measures your hearing and creates a profile perfectly tuned to you. Unrivaled wireless audio quality Qualcomm AptX Lossless delivers CD-quality, uncompressed audio over Bluetooth. Spatial audio from Dirac Virtue makes you feel like you're in the middle of your music. Choose to block out the world or let it in Adaptive active noise cancelation automatically adjusts with the loudness of your environment, while Social Mode lets you have a quick chat or be aware of your surroundings.

Keep the music going all day Eight hours of earbud battery life per charge, three additional charges from the case, and wireless case charging keeps the music playing all day. Best-in-class voice calls Eight microphones for voice pick-up, combined with super wideband voice from Qualcomm aptX Voice, keep your voice calls clear. Multipoint With Multipoint, your earbuds can be actively connected to two devices at the same time, allowing easy switching between devices.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The fit finish and best of all sound is excellent. Only minor complaint is the difficulty in taking the buds out of the case. There is a strong magnetic grip and not much to grab onto. Otherwise great earbuds with excellent sound especially a broad soundstage and clear separation. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brings new life to songs I have been listening to for years!
reviews.reviewText: I ordered these PerL Pros after reading that they use technology by Masimo. I am familiar with their work in the medical field, as they created algorithms (with my former company's help) to reduce noise artifacts in pulse oximetry measurements of oxygen saturation. I was intrigued by the idea that they were involved in improving the listening experience for listeners of high fidelity music.I recorded a YouTube video of myself unboxing and performing a first listening test of these headphones. I'm glad I captured it on video, because my facial expressions and comments say it all. These earbuds are AMAZING! They step you through a process to measure how you hear sound, and then adjust the audio to compensate for the way YOU hear, they then provide a listening experience for how you would hear through conventional headphones, and then allow you to switch to the 'personalized' audio that they generate. Let me just say, the difference was ASTOUNDING! I had to switch back to my wired earbuds to make sure they weren't pulling a fast one, and the way those earbuds sounded was just like the way the 'default' sound was frome these earbuds. I can tell you right now, you wil NEVER listen to the 'default' sound again. The personalized sound was, in the most descriptive term I can use, an aural orgasm. I literally got choked up when I first heard it, as verified by my YouTube video.I must say that I was listening to uncompressed audio, which can be played by the Pro version of these ear buds (but not the regular version). However, I must also add that I had stored on my smartphonme both an uncompressed (WAV) file of an audio track and also a high bitrate MP3 (320 kbps) encoding of a track, and the difference was like night and day. I thought it would be subtle, but for the track I listened to, it was not even close.The Pro version allows you to play uncompressed audio, whereas the regular PerLs do not. If you want the absolutely mindblowing experience, get the Pros. But even the MP3s sound so much better with the personalized listening turned on, so you can't go wrong with those, either.I HIGHLY recommend these to anyone who has a serious love for high-quality music. These produce sound every bit as good as my multi-thousand dollar media room system. The 'spatial' mode sounds like a surround sound decoding. I can't put it into words, but I'll conclude by saying I came very close to tears upon hearing the personalized sound profile generated by these amazing devices. Buy them, and buy the Pros if you can afford them. You will not regret it in the least.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Earbuds for audiophiles!
reviews.reviewText: Denon allows the user to choose between a preset setup or allow a customized setup for each earbud. There is an app to assist you through this up to three customized presets. The app scans each ear individually mapping how you interpret sound. This has created a very immersive experience without having to use a lot of volume.The only drawback of these are they are a bit larger than most earbuds and if you are smaller like myself, Denon does not provide more smaller interchangeable rubber tips.These are my new favorite way to practice music.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simply the best
reviews.reviewText: I don’t usually write reviews unless i think what I’ve received is either the best or worst thing I’ve ordered. These earbuds are just the best earbuds I’ve ever used in my life. I remember growing up I had a denon speaker like 30 years ago and it was my favorite speaker so when I heard they were making earbuds I knew they were going to be amazing. I listen to 90% hip-hop so if you like bass then these are for you. But I also listen to classic rock, country and piano as well and the clarity is flawless. I can’t say anything bad about these they stay in your ear because the have this little wing kinda like the Apple Beats Pro, but they beat the Apple pros the new Bose easily. The only thing they lack what those has is the ability to change ANC on the fly at least I don’t know how to. Not a lot of info on these yet because they are so knew but i own all three and Denon is just so much better in loudness, bass, vocals and clarity. Good job Denon

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A musical experience
reviews.reviewText: After you go through the sound personalization on these earbuds they take them to a whole new level sound wise.Sound clarity: 10Bass: 10Volume: 9Fit and comfort: 8.5Call quality: 9Battery: 6Overall rating: 8.75

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great sound quality, decent fit, ugly design, really weak and unmanageable ANC, great battery life. If you think you are going to be ok with it go for it but definitely not worth $350.00

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best sounding earbuds I’ve ever heard!
reviews.reviewText: With the accompanying app, you custom fit the sound to your ears, odd as it may sound. But it works! And I love how you can customize the bass thru “immersion” and get the sound you didn’t know was possible from wireless earbuds. I’ve got at least 10 sets of buds, including Bose, Sennheiser, BW, AirPods Pro, Masters&Dynamic and these instantly became my favorite because of the sound.Now, I haven’t had them long enough to determine battery life yet, to be fair. And I have only made one phone call thus far. But at this point, they seem on par with my other sets when it comes to those points.But I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend these to a friend, based on the sound alone.Love them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars They do not work separate
reviews.reviewText: they work well. The only bad thing is that you have to use both. does not work separately

Siempre me han gustado lo Nuraphones, su calidad de sonido han sido impresionante. Ahora que Denon adquirió la marca de Nuraphone, perfeccionarons los Nuratrue True Pro, y los transformaron en los Pear Pro. A mi punto de vista, estos audífonos tienen la mejor calidad de sonido de cualquier otra marca de renombre.

Pros:- amazing sound - deep/punchy/rumbling bass, clear mids, sparkling treble (best sounding earbuds I’ve ever heard up to this date including other leading brand premium earbuds)- customizable eq including bass levels “immersive mode”- customizable touch functions- control everything through touch functions- made with premium materials- charging case takes only an hour to fully charge (via usbc cable provided)- earbuds take about an hour to fully charge in case- ANC and transparency levels are pretty good- can connect up to 2 devices- very straight forward and easy to use, easy functionsCons:- gives less than 8 hours playtime in “performance mode” but maybe accurate on “low power mode” (takes out anc function, Spatial Audio, multi device pairing)- charging case does not give an extra 24 hours or 3 full charges on earbuds as advertised (tested battery charging after earbuds were dead and got around 1.9x/full charges only before charging case died and needed charging itself)- buds themselves are on the bigger side (about the size of a quarter) and not low profile or discreet, but still look nice- fit is ok but could be better, might need to adjust while in ear and/or try different sized tips and wings for a snug fit (probably not the best for high intense or aggressive workouts other than weight lifting which is fine)- could be a little more durable

reviews.reviewTitle: Se volete il massimo del sound fermatevi qui
reviews.reviewText: Top Top Top.....ho provato Gli Auricolari Top di gamma di Sony Sennheiser Apple Bose Skullcandy Jabra Samsung OnePlus Final Soundcore Technics az60mk e vi garantisco che nessuno di questi è paragonabile al sound dei Denon Nura Pearl pro....App stratosferica....L'investimento che val la pena, soldi spesi bene.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent sound but only average ANC
reviews.reviewText: These headphones sound great both for music, audiobooks and phone-calls, but ANC is not on par with Sony XM5 or Bose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I had a short list of 2/3 models/manufacturers. I put these head to head based on my own priorities which are mainly a) stable fit, b) sound quality and bass content, c) app control/usability.I have always had difficulties with fit and most ear buds fall out within minutes of installation. If anyone has ever used Etymotic Reasearch ear buds then you will know quality and brilliant sound and I found these are the only ones that fit in my ears, sadly they don’t manufacture wireless units and this is where I was heading.These Denon buds outperform even the Bose Ultra’s in my worthless opinion, the wing tips do the stability job and the Massimo software which surveys the internals of your ear canal and tailors the sound accordingly, amazing sound.The only negative is the poor response to a request to Denon UK for support (purely for buying spare ear tips) and when I finally got a response, after chasing twice, they put me onto a UK dealer who told me it was a 3-4 month delivery time and a price tag of £52 pounds for a full set of sizes of silicone ear tips, 3/4’s of which would be wasted. Denon, this needs to be sorted out.Not so great. The product itself, unbelievable. It was an independent manufacturer whom Denon purchased and rebranded, but still amazing product. 10/10
